Name: roygvib
AboutMe:
I mostly use modern Fortran and Python/Numpy for my numerical calculations, and now trying to learn Julia. A common feature of these languages is the colon (:) notation for array handling, which is very convenient :)

My feature requests for Fortran:

  • x.y (dot) as well as x%y as a component selector
  • short-hand assignment (+=, -=, *=, /=)
  • "implicit none" by default, other rules optional
  • Handy namespace resolution like modname.item
  • Built-in containers like dictionaries and dynamic arrays
  • Standardized interface for linear algebra, FFT, optimization etc (with switchable back-end libraries)
  • More support for string processing (split(), regex)
  • Function return variables in LHS (foo.bar() = 5) (available in F2008...?)
  • (If possible, type inference like "var", "auto"...)

My feature requests for Julia:

  • Easy multi-thread parallelization (coming soon...?)
  • Facilities to generate a stand-alone executable
  • Optional special symbol for line continuation
  • (If possible, lazy evaluation of array expressions)
  • (also, + and * for string concatenation, although a matter of taste...)

My feature requests for Python:

  • No snake on book covers ~~~~~~:>
  • Use of end rather than indent
  • 1-based indexing by default (yes, impossible...)
